verbLexeme: 1. To wear a long sleeve shirt.
2. Of a shirt, to have long sleeves. English = (be) long sleeved.
nominalLexeme: 1. A piece of clothing worn over your arms all the way down to the wrists which is attached at the shoulders to the rest of a garment. English = long sleeve shirt.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: marking the beginning and end of a long sleeve.
